newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Golden Valley to request more information.
newsitem.headline: Golden Valley to request more information.

text.p: Gold explorer Golden Valley Mines NL said on Tuesday that it would request more information on test results from the Busang deposit in Indonesia.

Golden Valley said this was in order to assess what further action might be appropriate following the report from Strathcona Mineral Services Ltd that concluded samples from Canadian miner Bre-X were falsified on a massive scale.

"We very much regret having to express the firm opinion that an economic gold deposit has not been identified in the SouthEast Zone of the Busang property, and is unlikely to be," Strathcona said in its Technical Audit Interim Report on May 3.
Golden Valley's connections with the Busang imbroglio is through a technical and financial agreement with Indonesian company PT Krueng Gasui (KG), controlled by businessman Joseph Merukh.
KG owns an undisputed 10 percent stake in the Muara Atan contract of work containing part of the Busang deposit.
By 10.25 a.m. (0025 GMT), Golden Valley shares were one cent lower at 37 cents on light turnover of 70,000 shares.
